definition: to insist on/to demand/to impose
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: It is the same with our children.
sentences.chinese: 人各有志，不必強求，對兒女也是如此。

sentences.english: If feelings are hard I'd rather be alone all my life.
sentences.chinese: 如果激情是強求我寧願一生顧影自憐。

sentences.english: Don't try to make our house the neatest in the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 不要強求把我們的房子弄成全社區最乾淨的。

sentences.english: And you can't force happiness to happen—but you can make sure you are aware of it when it does.
sentences.chinese: 快樂無法強求，但一旦降臨，你要確信自己有所體察。

sentences.english: The love of 100% is importuned to not was necessary between husband and wife, also unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 夫妻之間強求100%的愛沒有必要，也不大可能。

sentences.english: In their game of reopened possibilities, he didn’t want to overplay his own hand.
sentences.chinese: 在他們有可能重新開始的戀愛遊戲中，雷斯不想強求。

sentences.english: Everything has it 's destiny, we cannot importune.
sentences.chinese: 萬物都有它的宿命，我們不能強求。

sentences.english: Therefore, the right attitude to fame and wealth is not to importune and not to shuffle them.
sentences.chinese: 所以，對名利的態度應該是，不強求，也不推諉。

sentences.english: Love is about wanting to be together but be okay when you are apart.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是渴望雙方在一起，但並不強求，而是好聚好散。

sentences.english: Force, will only make you more tired.
sentences.chinese: 強求了，只會讓自己更累。

sentences.english: Close to is it casual, so nothing good to eat fruit.
sentences.chinese: 合則來不合則散，強求沒啥好果子喫。

sentences.english: Not too concerned about everything, but without the need to force it all Going.
sentences.chinese: 凡事不必太在意，更不需去強求，一切隨緣。

sentences.english: You shouldn't impose your philosophy of life on others, everyone has their own way of living.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都有自己的處世哲學，你不能強求別人怎樣。

sentences.english: We are firmly opposed to the policy of a Procrustean bed.
sentences.chinese: 我們堅決反對強求一致的政策。

sentences.english: The foundation was being importuned by fundraisers to contribute to new charities.
sentences.chinese: 募捐者正強求基金會爲慈善事業捐款。

definition: to let nature take its course (idiom)
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
easily/lightly/rashly
to take seriously/serious/No joking, really!
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
excessively/too
fate or chance that brings people together/predestined affinity or relationship/(Budd.) destiny
should not/to owe nothing
to follow one's heart's desires/to do as one pleases (idiom)
to compromise/to reach terms/a compromise
(reduplicated) whether... or.../never mind/fine (indicating acceptance or resignation)
